721642f-a.text:
15 to 27 Mercer Street, west side, south of and towards Grand Street. No. 15-17, at the left, which is not quite entirely included in the picture, is a six-story loft building, faced with iron, of a type which began to be built in the 1870's. No. 19 is a brick loft building, faced with stone, of the type built during and
shortly after the Civil War, in the 1860's.
Mercer Street is the first of a group of seven streets parallel to
and west of Broadway.
About 1915.
721642f-a.folder: Mercer Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY
